doc.field: Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records

This subseries consists of hundreds of buttons and political badges dating from the 1910s to 1990s. Buttons were both collected and created by the CPUSA and document a wide array of political topics and election campaigns. A large portion of the buttons relate to election campaigns, and feature CPUSA candidates at the state and national level as well as buttons in support of candidates not affiliated with the Communist Party. Political badges feature small pins dating from the 1920s and 1940s, which touch on topics such as participation in May Day demonstrations, political causes, labor affiliation, and Party support. They also include pins in support of early CPUSA political candidates. Other buttons document a broad range of political topics from the 1950s to early 2000s, including anti-capitalism, environmentalism, peace, civil rights, women's rights, and campaigns against political leaders in the United States.
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
